metadata.feature_description: Configure text editor type (Plain Text or Rich WYSIWYG) for content creation in Answers, Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events modules.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Answers module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Community Settings and locate the Enable WYSIWYG section
steps.expected: Enable WYSIWYG section is visible with checkboxes for Answers, Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events
steps.actual: Enable WYSIWYG section displayed with all four module checkboxes visible and initially checked

steps.action: Uncheck the Answers checkbox to set Plain Text editor (value 0)
steps.actual: Answers checkbox was successfully unchecked, changing from Rich editor to Plain Text editor

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Discussions module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Uncheck the Discussions checkbox to set Plain Text editor

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Ideas module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Uncheck the Ideas checkbox to set Plain Text editor

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set Social Events module to Plain Text editor

steps.action: Uncheck the Social Events checkbox to set Plain Text editor
steps.actual: Social Events checkbox was successfully unchecked. All four modules now set to Plain Text editor

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set all modules to Rich editor (WYSIWYG)

steps.action: Check all four checkboxes (Answers, Discussions, Ideas, Social Events) to enable Rich editor
steps.actual: All four checkboxes were successfully checked, enabling WYSIWYG editor for all modules

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save editor settings and verify persistence

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the editor settings
steps.expected: Settings are saved successfully with a confirmation message
steps.actual: Success notification 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the save operation

steps.action: Navigate away to Dashboard then return to Community Settings
steps.expected: Previously saved settings should persist and be displayed correctly
steps.actual: After navigating away and returning, all four Enable WYSIWYG checkboxes remained checked, confirming persistence

observations: The Enable WYSIWYG setting uses checkboxes where checked = Rich WYSIWYG editor (value 1) and unchecked = Plain Text editor (value 0)
Default values appear to be all Rich/WYSIWYG (all checkboxes checked) as expected for new installations
The UI correctly reflects the editor choice configuration for all four community modules: Answers, Discussions, Ideas, and Social Events
